dialogues.text: “Brown Shoes, Brown Shoes... BROWN SHOES! !” And the song crescendos into a loud stab. And ends. The crowd roars. Conor and Raphina fix eyes, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: We are Sing Street. The DJ takes over as the crowd cheer. INT. SYNGE STREET SCHOOL GYM —- BACKSTAGE -— CONTINUOUS Conor and the band get off stage, hugging. Raphina runs o to meet him. She kisses him. They SHOUT above the music a crowds.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHINA
dialogues.text: You look great!!

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: So do you!

dialogues.speaker: RAPHINA
dialogues.text: You guys were brilliant!! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: Really? Shit. Because I have to break the band up!!

dialogues.speaker: RAPHINA
dialogues.text: What? Why??

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: I failed my exams. And Eamon’s Mum won’t let him be in a band anymore. And my parents are selling the house. So we'll be moving... So I won't be able to call in and leave tapes for you and stalk you! She shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: We should go. She nods her head without needing to think.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHINA
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: On a boat.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHINA
dialogues.text: On the ferry, like? They won’t let us travel. You’re too young! I mean, I'd get away with it. But you're just a baby. He’s shaking his head, all this coming to him like a bolt from the blue.

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: No. We borrow a boat. From Dalkey. It’s 35 Miles. How far can that be? It’s like 45 minutes in good weather.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHINA
dialogues.text: You mean steal a boat?

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: Are you ready? There’s nothing going on here right now. She thinks about it. They look at each other, wide-eyed. EXT. SYNGE STREET SCHOOL / RAPHINA’S HOUSE - NIGHT Conor and Raphina run, hand in hand out of the school gat (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RAPHINA
dialogues.text: Do you forgive me? About Evan?

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: Was he any good? At sex?

dialogues.speaker: RAPHINA
dialogues.text: Not great.

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHINA
dialogues.text: You need to tell me you forgive me?

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: Something tells me I’1l always be forgiving you. They run on. She runs towards the steps of her house.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHINA
dialogues.text: Two minutes. I need to pack a few things.

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: Go! She laughs. EXT. CONOR’S HOUSE - NIGHT They run around the corner and up to Conor’s house, hand hand. Raphina is carrying a bag. INT. BRENDAN’S ROOM - MOMENTS LATER Brendan is writing something in his writing pad, and smok one. Conor knocks and enters, followed by Raphina.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Hey. What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: Shhh. Where are the parents?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: In bed. Why?

dialogues.speaker: RAPHINA
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Hey. You’re Raphina? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bows.

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: We need your help. Can you drive us to Dalkey?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: Grandad’s little pleasure boat is still moored there. We’re going to sail to England. The two of us. We're all set. But we need a lift to the harbour. Brendan looks at them. They are totally serious. He think about it.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Sure. When are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: Now.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: What!!? Do you have any friends there?

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Do you have any sterling?

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: No. Not a penny. She has her photographs. And I have my demo tapes and videos. He looks at them, smiling. He puts on his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Let's go. Raphina and Conor smile. INT. CONOR’S ROOM - MOMENTS LATER In a frenzy, Conor throws things in a shoulder bag. INT. ROBERT AND PENNY’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS Conor sneaks in to his parents’ room. He tip toes over to bedside locker. The car keys are under the lamp. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fishes them up silently, and as he does so, looks at h parents, asleep. Robert is sleeping on the floor beside t bed. Penny is on the bed, in a shaft of moonlight. Conor pauses, looking at them, almost smiling. Then his e fill up with tears. They look very vulnerable. He leans i his Mum...

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: I love you. Mum. She repositions herself in the bed. But she doesn’t hear We hold on him, smiling. EXT. CONOR’S HOUSE - NIGHT Conor and Brendan pull the tarpaulin off the old car in t driveway. The old car reverses out of the driveway. Conor and Raphi jump in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palpable excitement in the car as Brendan drives it south out to the sea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car pulls up to a small jetty. A few old boats bob up down in the moonlight. They all get out, carrying their b down towards one small pleasure cruiser. Dalkey Island ju across the water.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHINA
dialogues.text: Jesus, you were right, it’s really close. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: It’s a little bit further than that. They approach the hero boat. It’s an open boat, with a steering wheel, and a little tarpaulin shelter area at th back. It’s pretty basic.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHINA
dialogues.text: Is that it? It’s tiny! They look out to sea.

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: Nice and calm. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: You DO know it can get pretty choppy once you get out past the island?

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: We'll be grand. He heads. They follow him to the edge of the jetty. He jumps on board the boat, getting it ready. Brendan and Raphina stand watching him. He appears to know what he’s doing. Kind of. He finds a can of petrol in the boat next to it, and stea it, looking in his own engine.

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: I don't believe it. There’s still petrol in it. We’ll take this one as a spare. Ready? He pulls the cord. The engine coughs. But doesn’t take. Raphina jumps in, helping him, as Brendan does lookout. Finally, the engine comes to life, spluttering and coughi out smoke. Conor jumps back off, handing Raphina her bag, photograph and his stuff. She secures them under the little tarpauli Conor unties the boat from its mooring, throwing the rope board. Then he turns to his brother.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Call home as SOON as you get there, okay? No messing around.

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: I will. We’ll get into the Welsh coast. Then hitch down to London. Be there this evening.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: You’1ll get some flak from the parents for driving me out.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: I‘ll be fine. I’m bulletproof. He smiles. He is far from bulletproof. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, here. I wrote some words down. For a song. 115. Brendan reaches in his pocket and produces a foolscap of paper with loads of lyrics written on it.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: They're just a stream of consciousness thing. It’s about this kid and a girl. In the future. If you get there, put some music to them some day. I’m serious. Could be a good song.

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: Okay. I will. Conor takes it and folds it up carefully, and puts it in inside coat pocket. Conor jumps back onto the boat. Raphina Brendan fade up this is

dialogues.speaker: RAPHINA
dialogues.text: Come and visit us. You seem like a mad bastard.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. You look after that brother of mine. He’s going to be lost without me.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHINA
dialogues.text: Hah! I will.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: And I hope you can swim. shakes Brendan’s hand and hugs him from the boat. is getting a little emotional as A SONG starts to on the track. He hugs his brother one more time. But no time for tears. Conor steers the little boat out of the harbour. They wav back to Brendan, who stands on the jetty waving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat sets out onto the sea. immediately met by a strong wind. The song swells...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shelter of the harbour is The sun is coming up, but a heavy mist is refusing to lif The waves are growing in force as the little boat sets of (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raphina looks nervous. It starts raining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan watches them from behind the wheel of his car. Th look very vulnerable in the distance, bobbing up and down starts screaming. For no reason. Shouting and screaming a cheering, looking at the little boat making its escape. I way, he’s on that boat. The boat disappears around the si of the island. Brendan smiles, shouting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it’s raining hard. The boat is buffeted by waves.

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: (shouting) You’1l want to sit down around now

dialogues.speaker: RAPHINA
dialogues.text: (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: WHAT
dialogues.text: In answer to her question, the boat is hit by a good wave knocking Raphina over. She huddles up under the tarpaulin, soaked. Conor steers the boat with focus and determination. She watches him, scared, as the song soars. Ahead, nothing but mist and rain. No sign of a coastline. Then, a bellowing HORN is heard, off. Conor looks out. Out of the mist a HUGE CAR FERRY is appearing, travelling in the same direction, but cutting across their boat’s course.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHINA
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!!!!! Conor slams the boat into reverse. The engine grinds in protest. The FERRY passes them by. Up on deck, countless Irish immigrants stand, smoking, drinking cans of Guinnes watching the sun come up etc. Some of them see the little boat below, pointing and laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.O.V. Shot from deck of ferry.  117.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor waves up at the people on deck. Then speeds onwards Raphina smiles, looking at his back. She tries to light u cigarette. Then gives up. She starts laughing. The SONG really takes off now. It’s Conor’s voice singing The lyrics are about him and Raphina. About their future. model and a singer. About staying together. Written from older brother’s perspective. What we’re hearing is clearl marriage of Brendan’s lyrics and Conor’s music. From the future. And it’s the only clue to whether Conor and Raphi ever made it. Because right now, all we can see is mist, rain, and grim determination on COSMO’S drenched face.... Snap to black.

dialogues.speaker: BEST ORIGINAL SCREENPLAY
dialogues.text: John Carney y ‘THE WEINSTEIN COMPANY www.TWCAwards.com
